programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Investigator Jack Reacher leaps off the pages of Lee Child's novel and onto the big screen in this thriller. When a horrible crime is committed, all evidence points to the suspect in custody, who offers up a single note in defense: "Get Jack Reacher!"

programme.title: Accident Man
programme.desc: Mike is a tough hitman, who makes his hits look like accidents or suicide. He's in a gang of hitmen, each with his own style. When his loved ex is killed, Mike looks for those responsible.

programme.title: Accident Man: Hitman's Holiday
programme.desc: A hit man must beat the top assassins in the world.

programme.title: Armored
programme.desc: A crew of officers at an armored transport security firm embark on the ultimate heist â€“ against their own company. The seemingly fool-proof plan soon proves to be useless when an unexpected witness interferes, as the plan quickly unravels.

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Investigator Jack Reacher leaps off the pages of Lee Child's novel and onto the big screen in this thriller. When a horrible crime is committed, all evidence points to the suspect in custody, who offers up a single note in defense: "Get Jack Reacher!"

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: Mel Gibson stars as a Los Angeles policeman who recently lost his wife and has been acting increasingly unstable. Danny Glover plays a homicide detective with an impeccable record and a loving family. Now the two are stuck with each other as partners.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 2
programme.desc: Mel Gibson and Danny Glover are back as a volatile pair of LAPD detectives. This time, the cops are unhappy with their assignment to baby-sit an accountant. But the mob wants the accountant deadâ€”and is killing everyone who gets in its way.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 3
programme.desc: Police officers Riggs (Mel Gibson) and Murtaugh (Danny Glover) team for the third time. This time, they must track down a crooked cop who has stolen weapons from the Los Angeles police depot.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Moons of Olympus
programme.desc: There are many more worlds in our solar system than just the planets. The mysterious moons of the gas giants may hold much more than we ever imagined. Each one is unique, and each one deserves a scrutinous eye.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Gas Giants
programme.desc: In the cold, dark expanse of our solar system, beyond the asteroid belt, lie the giant planets. Some can be seen with the naked eye, others have been visited by our camera. What secrets do they hold?

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Danger, Asteroids Ahead
programme.desc: The threat of an asteroid strike is a very real danger in our solar system, mankind is now in a position to defend the planet from such an eventuality.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: First Light
programme.desc: The Hubble Telescope is nearing its end, the replacements are ready to go, ready to peer further back in time and space than can be imagined.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Night Fire
programme.desc: The Northern Lights are more than just beautiful; they tell us about the make up of our planet, our sun, and may even be a signpost for the possibility of life on other planets.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Virtual Universe
programme.desc: Our understanding of the cosmos is limited by the amount of time we have to see it. Fortunately, computer simulations can help us see how galaxies interact over millions of years, and even how dark matter structures the universe.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Stargazer's Paradise
programme.desc: The Atacama desert is a perfect place for watching the night sky. With still winds and only a handful of cloudy nights each year, it allows scientists to get the absolute most out of their tools.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Hubble's Renaissance
programme.desc: Before we can reach space, we must first be able to see it. Hundreds of years ago, the simple telescope was used to give us a seemingly closer vantage. Today, we use the awe-inspiring, and super powerful, Hubble Space Telescope.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Superscopes
programme.desc: Discover the most powerful telescopes on the planet as they search for the mysteries of the universe.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rainbow
programme.desc: The human eye can only see visible light, a small spectrum of electromagnetic waves. Today, we have instruments that let us perceive all wavelengths.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Seasons of Saturn
programme.desc: Saturn is the second largest planet and has an astonishing 60 moons in its orbit. Thanks to the Cassini mission, itâ€™s also one of the most studied and most photographed planets in our neighborhood.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Vesta Unveiled
programme.desc: With the Dawn missions exploration of the asteroid Vesta and the dwarf planet Ceres, asteroids are a hot topic. See what these incredible missions have uncovered.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Water Worlds
programme.desc: They key ingredient to life in the universe is water. Until recently we thought Earth was the only place in the solar system to have any water at all. Now that probes are peering around nearby worlds we are finding that is just not the case.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Gravity
programme.desc: Gravity has long been a force that has intrigued scientists. Now, for the first time scientists are probing to detect gravity waves in space as well as mapping the gravity patterns of the moon.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Science and the Shuttle
programme.desc: For more than 25 years the shuttle was our ticket to space, and our laboratory in orbit. Uncover the legacy of this amazing machine, and see what lies ahead.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Landing on Mars
programme.desc: Mars sparks our curiosity like no other planet because it is so reachable. Despite having landed there, most of the information we gather is still done by instruments in the planet's orbit.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Milky Way
programme.desc: This episode traces our view of the Milky Way, from the mythology of ancient skywatchers to the efforts of scientists to map it from the inside out.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Big Bang
programme.desc: When it comes to the birth of the universe, not even the most creative work of imagination can rival what science has revealed about the Big Bang.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Hot Zone
programme.desc: Mercury is one of Earth's closest neighbors, but until very recent exploratory missions, it eluded astronomers' best efforts to learn its secrets.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rays
programme.desc: Cosmic rays can tell us much about the universe. They are not simply another form of light, but carriers of information about powerful and unseen processes at work thousands or even millions of light years away.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Fermi Paradox
programme.desc: The Fermi Paradox asks the ultimate question: why have alien civilizations not presented themselves?

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Landsat
programme.desc: An advanced $900 million planetary explorer designed to peer across multiple wavelengths to reveal intricate details undetectable by the human eye.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Eye of the Beholder
programme.desc: The night sky has always been a source of wonder and mystery. In the quest to explore the universe, our greatest ally is the Hubble telescope.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Painted By Light
programme.desc: When the universe formed, all of space blazed white-hot, but it didn't last. Darkness reined for 200 million years before the light was reborn.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Colour
programme.desc: Color is essential to both art and astronomy. When measured, it can tell us the temperature, chemical composition, and motion of astronomical objects.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Perspective
programme.desc: For most of human history, the night sky seemed two-dimensional. To our ancestors, this perspective gave no hint to the universe's true depth.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: From living in caves to grand mansions, shelter has always been high on the list of priorities.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Examining the history of the Great Wall of China.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Without water, civilization is simply not possible; Romans took control of their water seriously.

programme.title: Clerks II
programme.desc: A calamity at Dante and Randall's shops sends them looking for new horizons, but they ultimately settle at Mooby's, a fictional Disney-McDonald's-style fast-food empire. Sequel to the 1994 film by Kevin Smith.

programme.title: Clerks III
programme.desc: Following a massive heart attack, Randal enlists his friends and fellow clerks Dante, Elias, Jay, and Silent Bob to make a movie immortalizing his life at the convenience store that started it all.

programme.title: Jay and Silent Bob Reboot
programme.desc: Jay and Silent Bob return to Hollywood to stop a reboot of the BLUNTMAN AND CHRONIC movie from getting made.

programme.title: Barbershop
programme.desc: Calvin, who inherited a struggling barbershop, views the shop as nothing but a burden and a waste of his time. After selling the shop to a local loan shark, Calvin slowly begins to see his father's vision and legacy.

programme.title: Robot Wars World Series
programme.desc: Former champions Apollo, Sabretooth, Terrorhurtz and Gabriel 2 take on a true legend, the highly flammable Diotoir. Making up the Rest of the World team are TMWHK from the Netherlands, Cobra from Belgium and Rabid M8 from Portugal.

programme.title: Robot Wars World Series
programme.desc: Reigning champions Eruption lead a team of some of the fiercest robots in the UK, Big Nipper, Concussion and Thor all fighting for international glory. Their opposition are captained by silicon valley millionaire Michael Mauldin and robot Cathadh.

programme.title: MechMania
programme.desc: The competition begins with the first heat, with new robots and some familiar faces as teams get a feel for the arena and size up their competition.

programme.title: MechMania
programme.desc: The second heat of the competition takes the action to Crawley in the south of England. Winners and losers from Heat One face fresh opponents, fighting to secure a win and guarantee their place in the finals.

programme.title: MechMania
programme.desc: It is the last chance for teams to secure a spot before the final as they clash in one-on-one matches for a place in the top 16. New robots join the fray, hoping for a last-minute victory to advance to the championship.

programme.title: MechMania
programme.desc: The most battle-hardened combat robots in the UK compete in the MechMania Grand Final. After three heats, the tournament switches to a one-on-one sudden-death format until one team emerges as the victor.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: More mechanical mayhem as teams of roboteers do battle to become king of the scrap heap. Let the trials begin!

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The small but mighty Storm II takes on Mayhem, Rhino and Supernova in round one, as Mayhem fights its first battle. Team Steel Avenger named the heat, the Heat of Doom as it includes Supernova, Shredder Evolution and Storm II.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Thermidor 2 and Kronic the Wedgehog meet again in a replay of another heat. Thermidor 2 puts up an impressive fight as it takes down every robot in its path.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Heat number 11 of the series sees controversy as T-Wrecks makes a bold move that breaks the rule about having an active weapon. Round one pits Mantis, Infernal Contraption, Bulldog Breed and Jabber against one another.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Eight robots enter the arena, including old crowd favourite, Behemoth. Heat L also features a grudge match to settle the score between Behemoth and Crushtacean.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Champion robot Panic Attack returns in the thirteenth heat of the series. A series 5 round is replicated as the Four Horsemen and Team Panic Attack are once again pitted against each another.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: In the 14th heat of the seventh series, round one sees Spawn Again, Chip and NEATer Machine do battle with Revenge of Trouble & Strife. The next round pits Topbot against R.O.C.S and Raging Nightmare.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: As the semifinals draw near, Bigger Brother makes its mark in the arena, as it takes on Colossus and Typhoon 2 in round one. Round two sees DisConstructor tackle Xenomorph, Hammerhead 2 and Iron-Awe 2.1.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Firestorm makes a long-awaited comeback in a battle against Daisy-Cutter, Black and Blue, and Bamm Bamm. Heat P determines the robots who will make it to the semi-finals of the seventh series.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Eight competitors compete for a spot in the next semi-final round as half are eliminated. Round 1 sees Tornado employ the use of a spinner drum to flip its opponent.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The four victors from the round 1 semifinal compete for a place in the grand final. Round 1 sees Firestorm 5 go head-to-head with Mute, in a flipping assault.

programme.title: George And The Dragon
programme.desc: A knight (James Purefoy, "Rome") returning from the Crusades takes on a dragon after the disappearance of the kindly Princess Lunna (Piper Perabo, "Coyote Ugly"). With Patrick Swayze.

programme.title: The Dark Crystal
programme.desc: On another planet in the distant past, a Gelfling embarks on a quest to find the missing shard of a magical crystal, and to restore order to his world.

programme.title: Captain Sabertooth
programme.desc: The orphan boy Pinky follows the Captain on an exciting and dangerous journey across the big oceans to the kingdom of Lama Rama, hunting for a treasure and the answer to who is Pinky's father.

programme.title: Knucklehead
programme.desc: After incurring a large debt with a local criminal ringleader, Eddie Sullivan creates a get-rich-quick scheme and enlists a gentle giant named Walter as his unwitting accomplice.

programme.title: First Daughter
programme.desc: Samantha Mackenzie wants what every college freshman desires: to experience life away from home and parents. It's not going to be easy, however, because home for Sam is the White House, and her dad is the President of the United States.

programme.title: Mail Order Monster
programme.desc: A girl seeks help and guidance from a robot monster to cope with the bullies at school and her father's new girlfriend.

programme.title: Labyrinth
programme.desc: Sixteen-year-old Sarah must solve a labyrinth to rescue her baby brother when he is taken by the Goblin King.

programme.title: Space Warriors
programme.desc: Desperate to follow in the footsteps of his absent astronaut father, 13-year-old Jimmy's dreams come true when he wins one of five opportunities to compete for a scholarship to Space Camp.

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.desc: A raven-haired enchantress, Cassie Nightingale, mysteriously moves into the local haunted mansion, 'Grey House', and seems to change her neighbors lives using a hint of magic causing many to think sheâ€™s a witch.

programme.title: Kids From Planet 62F
programme.desc: Four friends find an object with special powers that belongs to two alien kids from the planet 62F. Now they must race to get it back to its rightful owners, but NASA are on their tail and they will stop at nothing to get their hands on it.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Triple Crossed
programme.desc: It's week 12 of the North Atlantic Bluefin tuna season, and one captain's decision to withhold information fractures ties with an important ally.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna Trifecta
programme.desc: It's week 13 of the North Atlantic Bluefin tuna season and, with only three weeks left to fish, and the number one position on the line, every Gloucester captain is desperate to stack the deck with bluefin.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Knock Out Punch
programme.desc: It's week 14 of the Bluefin tuna season and with less than two weeks of fishing left, the top four Gloucester crews are locked in a tight race to be New England's best Bluefin boat.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bait and Switch (Finale Part 1)
programme.desc: It's the final week of the season and Hard Merchandise holds a narrow lead over the fleet

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: There are less than five days left before the Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season in Gloucester, Massachusetts closes and the competition will come downto the very last day of fishing

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Masters of Bluefin (Special)
programme.desc: Take a look back at the best moments from previous seasons as the top fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, battle for supremacy while they pursue the elusive Atlantic Bluefin Tuna

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Something to Prove
programme.desc: The best fishermen from Gloucester, Massachusetts, set out on the first day of the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna and Tequila
programme.desc: It's week two of the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season and Erin & Sarah, the father/daughter fishing operation from Portland, Maine, try to keep their lead over the Gloucester fleet.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: May the Fish Be with You
programme.desc: It's week three of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season, one captain is forced to choose between two friends on the water.
programme.sub-title: May the Fish Be with You

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: It's week four of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and tensions start to boil for Wicked Pissah's new crew, while two rival harpoon boats face off.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Big Hauls and Downfalls
programme.desc: It's week five of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and teamwork is the name of the game for Gloucester fleet.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Help Wanted
programme.desc: Sharks, shorts and crew problems plague the fleet, but two captains get blessed with new mates while harpoon boats battle for the last fish of their season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Snitches Get Fishes
programme.desc: Midway through the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season, a long-Â­-running feud lands one Gloucester captain in hot water, while another boat struggles to keep their crew intact.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Opposites Distract
programme.desc: At the halfway mark of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season some teams are working well together and killing it while others are floundering and on the verge of killing each other.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Take It to the Bank
programme.desc: The Gloucester captains face a familiar decision: whether or not to take the long, high-Â¬-risk journey to Georges Bank to increase their chances of a big bluefin haul.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Doubling Down
programme.desc: After a massive haul offshore on Georges Bank last week, Captain Dave Carraro of FV-Â¬-Tuna.com and Captain TJ Ott of Hot Tuna decide to double down and make the long trip again.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Riders in the Storm
programme.desc: When a violent storm rolls in during week eleven, the Gloucester captains face a tough decision at a critical time: do they fish... or flee?

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Comeback Kid
programme.desc: With four weeks left in the season, Hard Merchandise and FV-Â¬- Tuna.Com struggle to stay at the top of the fleet as an unexpected adversary, the Wicked Pissah.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna Invaders
programme.desc: With only three weeks left, the North Atlantic captains face more competition than ever as boats from all over head to Gloucester and battle for those last bluefin of the season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Thin Bluefin Line
programme.desc: There is a narrow margin separating the top four boats and only two weeks left in the season.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, comedian Lil Duval stops by the studio; Rob warns of the dangers of "Evil Tires" and how having a "Florida Vibe" isn't always a good thing.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Sterling and Chanel explore the fun side of "Chatter Gas," experience some "No Pros" going down and expose true feelings in "Surprise, I Hate You."

programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob watches Finland's craziest stuntmen, The Dudesons, become "Nudesons," blast butts with "Fire in the Hole" and take aim at some "Human Targets."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new Ridiculousness, skating sensation Nyjah Huston and Rob watch some "Less Gifted" athletes, see poorly behaved guys "Getting Nyjah'd" and learn how to forget everything with some heavy-hitting "Mind Erasers."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, dancer and choreographer Derek Hough and Rob discuss the "Future of Dance," see what happens to people with "Garbage Feet" and learn how to "Knock Yourself Out."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Sterling and Chanel see some beauty destroyed in "Not the Face!" redheads get slammed in "Code Red" and some distracted people meet their fate in "Obliviousness."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, rapper Tyga laughs with Rob as guys get nutted in "Rack City," bad drivers think they "Found a Spot" and innocent victims get painfully close to sneakers in "Check Out My Kicks."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, foodie famous Guy Fieri and Rob take a tour through the Ridiculous side of "Flavortown," learn how to "Tame Your Flame," and say farewell to "Junky Cars."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Harley "Epic Mealtime" Morenstein and Rob expose some "Epic Meal Crimes," discover the shock of "Human Bacon," and unravel the big meaning of "Balthazars."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob hangs with Sterling and Chanel to breakdown some "Extreme Hugging," see why people get "Un-followed" and join in the fun of a little "Slap Fight."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, actress Lacey Chabert and Rob break down old folk's "Last Minute Adventures," and lovers' "Tender Moments," while Lacey explains why it's not always easy "Acting Sexy."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, supermodel Chrissy Teigen shows off her "Swimsuit Issues," while Rob explores the funny side of "Party Bruises" and the power of "Healing Hugs."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, TV host and restaurateur Eddie Huang picks through some "Hot Trash," explains to Rob what it means to be "Fresh Off The Boat," and enjoys drivers even worse than Eddie

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, comedian David Spade and Rob search for the world's best "Stunt Butts," get a little redneck with some "Joe Dirts," and wave "Buh-Bye" to some poor souls.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, multi-talented host Maria Menounos shows off her "Signature Laughs," shares the secret to "Instant Abs" with Rob, and explains what it's like to be a true "Stinkface."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, actor David Arquette shows Rob how he gets "Ready to Rumble." David reveals the danger of going through life with "Power Logs" and how easy it is to get "Bounced."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Sterling, and Chanel ditch the CrossFit and go straight to "CrashFit," assess some serious "Mom Damage," and get schooled by some "Baby Bosses."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, skateboarding legend Danny Way becomes life-long "Tug Buddies" with Rob, travels the world in "Landmarked," and hits the "Chatter Gas" for some post-dental fun.

programme.title: This Week's Top Stories
programme.desc: Making sense of the big stories that made news across Canada and around the world from this past week.

programme.title: About That
programme.desc: Andrew Chang expands the understanding of the stories everybody's talking about.

programme.title: About That
programme.desc: Andrew Chang expands the understanding of the stories everybody's talking about.

programme.title: Marketplace
programme.desc: Canada's consumer watchdog series since 1972, this news program uncovers wrongdoings in the marketplace. With the help of hidden cameras, correspondents dish out the dirt on not so "clean" business practices. Once they get the evidence they need on tape, they apply pressure on businesses to change policies vis-a-vis the products and services they provide to the public.

programme.title: Marketplace
programme.desc: Canada's consumer watchdog series since 1972, this news program uncovers wrongdoings in the marketplace. With the help of hidden cameras, correspondents dish out the dirt on not so "clean" business practices. Once they get the evidence they need on tape, they apply pressure on businesses to change policies vis-a-vis the products and services they provide to the public.

programme.title: The Fifth Estate
programme.desc: The top-notch team of hosts Bob McKeown, Gillian Findlay, Mark Kelley and Habiba Nosheen provides unique and engaging documentaries from Canada and beyond. "The Fifth Estate" is a reference to the term Fourth Estate, and was chosen to highlight the program's determination to go beyond everyday news into original journalism. The series has won numerous awards for its reporting, including Gemini Awards, International Emmys, the Michener Award, and even an Academy Award for a 1981 episode that was released in theaters the following year. Since September 1975, Canadians have tuned in to experience interesting stories that are always well-crafted and thought-provoking.

programme.title: Under the Spell of Horses
programme.sub-title: Under the Spell of the Horses - India
programme.desc: Proud elegance, silky-shiny coats and a graceful, powerful physique â€“ the supreme Marwari horses have been worshipped in India as magical creatures for thousands of years. People say they descended directly from the Gods, that once when the Gods were sitting round the fire, there was so much soot that one of the Gods had to cry. One of the tears from his right eye changed into a stallion, and one of his tears from the left eye produced a mare. Ever since, the people in Rajasthan have believed that horses are Gods. Maharaja â€“ palaces, temples and citadels, women in colourful saris and men with bright turbans â€“ the land of the Rajas, the kingâ€™s sons, arouse fantasies reminiscent of One Thousand and One Nights. Lively trading and war-related incidents from the past have led to the emergence of a unique horse culture in the region: Marwaris are the proud horses of the Indian Rajas. Each year in November, the small, barren desert oasis of Pushkar is transformed into a place of pilgrimage for millions of Indians. Everybody who is anybody on the horse scene in Rajasthan - Maharajas, breeders and horse masters - meets at the Pushkar Mela, the turbulent market for over 50,000 horses and camels. Pushkar is the place where the legendary Marwaris are bought and sold.

programme.title: Under the Spell of Horses
programme.sub-title: Under the Spell of the Horses - Morocco
programme.desc: Once a year the royal city of Meknes is transformed into an oriental camp. Two thousand curious onlookers gather round the square. More than five hundred riders are expected to take part in this major Fantasia, a warlike display of horsemanship. 56-year old Lachsen Slimani is also obsessed with riding games. He lives with his family on a remote highland plateau in the Middle Atlas. Lachsen is proud because his 18-year old son Mohammed wants to follow in his fatherâ€™s footsteps. For that he needs his own horse, so the tradition goes. Lachsen wants to fulfil this dream for his son. So, in order to get the money together for the horse, he takes off on an adventure and is travelling to Quarzazate, which is also called the Hollywood of the desert.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: Wild Moments: Four Seasons - Spring & Summer
programme.desc: In accordance with the seasons and with deep respect of nature, people all over the world celebrate their long-standing traditions. In Japan the first picnics at the cherry blossom festival kick off the long-awaited outdoor season, while the Scots perform their Highland Games. In the summer the Latvians celebrate the biggest party of the year: midsummer night. The vast wildflower meadows provide them with wreathes of flowers which have magical healing powers; animals are provided with an abundance of insects. This enables the rare hoopoe to breed in Latvia. In the Spree forest region, an enchanting river landscape south-east of Berlin, farmers still harvest the famous Spreeforest Cucumber. "Four seasons - Many traditions" is a visual journey around the globe meeting people who are passionate and dedicated at keeping old traditions alive.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: In accordance with the seasons and with deep respect of nature, people all over the world celebrate their long-standing traditions. Near the outermost border of Europe, in Bashkiria, generations of bee keepers have collected honey from rare wild bees, the Burzyan bees. In Japan the last of the Usho catch fish with "living fishing rods": trained cormorants. Traditionally, they provided the Emperor's family with fresh fish. In Poland carp are fished from the ponds to provide everybody with carp for Christmas dinner - this is an old Polish tradition. In Frisia winter is driven out by fires at what is known as "Biikebrennen", and in Hungary the "Busho" - frightening characters wearing wooden masks - do a similar job. "Four seasons - Many traditions" is a journey, meeting people who are passionate at keeping old traditions alive.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: Wildlife filmmakers experience many emotionally touching moments on their expeditions while observing their main characters over a longer period of time. A lucky moment for Oliver Goetzl and Ivo NÃ¶renberg in the Yellowstone National Park: When a wolf appears they give up on a lone newborn bison. But at the very last moment, its mother arrives and saves it. On an expedition in the Himalayas, Henry Mix is able to find Bengal tigers. A kangaroo mother even allows Thoralf Grospitz to film its tiny baby in her pouch. But they witness sad moments as well: On the Arctic Wrangel Island, Uwe Anders has to watch a snowy owl mother stop feeding one of her two chicks due to the shortage of food that year. "Big emotions" shows the most touching and the most heart-breaking moments wildlife filmmakers have experienced all over the world.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: As an animal filmmaker, one often deals with lots of strange old birds. No wonder, that so much can go wrong. After a long day of filming, a surprise awaits at the camp: Wolves have been looking for chocolate biscuits! Yet these are not the only things that can happen in the Arctic. Yann Sochaczewski is out and about in the magnificent Grand Canyon. On his raft on the Colorado River, he risks life and limb in doing so. In Australia, Thoralf Grospitz and Jens Westphalen play cat and mouse with an odd bird, that turns out to be a real entertainer. In the Serengeti, Reinhard Radke despairs of the many tourists who constantly walk in front of his lens. Wildlife filmmakers travel around the world for these very encounters. They bring nature into our living rooms, experience the beautiful, the saddest and the most poignant moments. And many funny ones.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: When humans and wild animals live next door to one another, things can sometimes be a little hairy. Some organise themselves in impertinent gangs, others mutually cultivate their own friendships. In New Zealand, keas organise themselves into gangs and obviously have it in for all the rubber seals belonging to winter sports enthusiasts. Their motto: nibble all you can. In Australia, Klaus WeiÃŸmann and Rolf Sziringer struggle with a huge invasion. Thousands of flies have taken a liking to the two men. This causes frayed nerves. And in Zambia, Jens Westphalen and Thoralf Grospitz capture a veritable display of elephants with the camera. Every year, their fine noses lead them into a hotel garden - in which the fruits on the wild mango tree are ripe. But, there is a catch: To get to their picnic, they have to walk through the lobby. This is what happens when buildings are erected around even older premises.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: Nature has many weird creatures to offer and often these animals fascinate us the most. There are ants in Australia's outback that use specialised workers as living honey pots. In Africa in the endless Bangweulu wetlands of Zambia the shoebill is on the hunt for fish, a bird that definitely lives up to its name. Finally in the Brazilian rainforests lurk gruesome river monsters in the Amazon abyss that send shivers down the spine of even the most experienced divers. But there are also intense human-animal-relationships like the close bond between a German diver and a dolphin female who explore the Atlantic off the coast of Ireland, or the "easy rider" in California who has taken care of an African elephant bull for more than 25 years. Weird! is a breathtaking journey to visit animals around the globe who are somehow different.

programme.title: Crazy Creature Costumes
programme.desc: Animals shock us with the most bizarre appearances - some even look like they've been dressing up. But the weird and wonderful shapes and colours of nature are vital to the animals' lives. Sometimes they're disguised to help blend in, other times they are designed to stand out and show off. But whether it's a monkey in make-up or a salamander's toxic stripes, the weird and wonderful outfits enable the creature to thrive.

programme.title: The Dying King
programme.desc: In the open wilderness of Africa, there are only 20.000 lions living a free life. In the last decade, humans have killed hundreds of thousandsâ€“ mostly for purely hunting purposes. In the last couple of years, a new industry has developed called the canned hunting, where animals are bred for 4-5 years then released into a confined area. This confined area is created for the sole purpose optimizing the odds of the hunter obtaining a kill. The corpse of the dead, often male, lion is thereby treated as a trophy. Tourists pay up to 40, 000 USD for this 'privilege'.

programme.title: Masai Mara: The Big Hunt
programme.desc: When food supply in the Serengeti dwindles, the Masai Mara is a paradise for predators. As the black wildebeests, gazelles, zebras and antelopes make their yearly trip from the south of the Serengeti to the north, natureâ€™s best laid trap, the Mara River in Kenya is waiting ahead. Captivating shots filmed under water show how crocodiles prepare for the Big Hunt while other predators lurk on the banks awaiting their bounty. The biggest problems for the migratory animals are the Mara and the Tarek River, where they have to put their lives at risk to get to the other side. A great number of them die as they jump into the river and break their legs, while others are carried away by the drift or drown. Those who are not victims of the river itself risk falling prey to the crocodiles. We entered this unchartered territory, the crocodile domain by heading under water. Follow these predators in and around their habitat and watch prides of lions map out their game plan. In slow-motion, we show you the final showdown between predator and prey. Will it be a successful hunt or will the hoofed animals persevere?

programme.title: White Lions: Born Wild
programme.sub-title: White Lions: Born Wild - Episode 1: Against all Odds
programme.desc: The two sisters are born as white as snow in May 2009 in South Africaâ€™s Kruger Park. Growing up in this vast, wild wilderness they must not only overcome the same survival challenges that all young lion cubs face, they must also overcome the threats their high visibility brings. In the African bush, anything unusual stands out and is often eliminated by eagle-eyed predators. Will our cubs survive? The odds are stacked against them â€“ 80 percent of all newborn lion cubs donâ€™t make it to adulthood.

programme.title: White Lions: Born Wild
programme.sub-title: White Lions: Born Wild - Episode 2: Fight for Survival
programme.desc: â€˜White Lions â€“ Born Wildâ€™ is a true wildlife story, with strong characters and closely studied behaviour. We follow the cubsâ€™ progress as they embark on the pathway to adulthood, learning to hunt, learning to avoid danger, learning to live in their white coats. This is a strong behaviour-led film, a coming-of-age story of a very rare and unusual pair of lions. Through their eyes, we learn what it is really like to be a lion in Africa.

programme.title: Under the Spell of Horses
programme.sub-title: Under the Spell of the Horses - Iceland
programme.desc: Iceland, the island of longing in the North. The biggest volcanic island in the world is known for its grandiose landscape, for its geysers and glaciers. But it is even more famous for its horses. Icelandic horses are considered the liveliest horses in the whole of Europe with the greatest stamina. They tÃ¶lt over mossy banks and lava rock unfazed by rivers, glaciers and scree slopes. In Nordic mythology the steed are never far behind the warriors. Where would Siefgried be without his horse Grani, or Odin without Sleipnir. Even the sun wouldnâ€™t rise or set if â€œawake earlyâ€ and â€œvery quickâ€ werenâ€™t pulling their chariot. From the beginning of colonisation, the Icelanders had the kind of close relationship with their horses usually only seen among the horse-riding peoples of Central Asia. And something of this love for horses still exists today. Life without horses would be unthinkable for Haukur Goroarsson, too. The 34-year old lives with his family in Vatnsdalur, a fertile valley in the North four hours by car from the capital city, Reykjavik. For him Icelandic horses are â€œa sort of Viking on four legsâ€. The settlement of this inhospitable island on the Arctic Circle would not have been possible without the animals. The stone deserts in the countryâ€™s interior are too vast to be crossed on foot.

programme.title: Under the Spell of Horses
programme.sub-title: Under the Spell of the Horses - India
programme.desc: Proud elegance, silky-shiny coats and a graceful, powerful physique â€“ the supreme Marwari horses have been worshipped in India as magical creatures for thousands of years. People say they descended directly from the Gods, that once when the Gods were sitting round the fire, there was so much soot that one of the Gods had to cry. One of the tears from his right eye changed into a stallion, and one of his tears from the left eye produced a mare. Ever since, the people in Rajasthan have believed that horses are Gods. Maharaja â€“ palaces, temples and citadels, women in colourful saris and men with bright turbans â€“ the land of the Rajas, the kingâ€™s sons, arouse fantasies reminiscent of One Thousand and One Nights. Lively trading and war-related incidents from the past have led to the emergence of a unique horse culture in the region: Marwaris are the proud horses of the Indian Rajas. Each year in November, the small, barren desert oasis of Pushkar is transformed into a place of pilgrimage for millions of Indians. Everybody who is anybody on the horse scene in Rajasthan - Maharajas, breeders and horse masters - meets at the Pushkar Mela, the turbulent market for over 50,000 horses and camels. Pushkar is the place where the legendary Marwaris are bought and sold.

programme.title: Under the Spell of Horses
programme.sub-title: Under the Spell of the Horses - Morocco
programme.desc: Once a year the royal city of Meknes is transformed into an oriental camp. Two thousand curious onlookers gather round the square. More than five hundred riders are expected to take part in this major Fantasia, a warlike display of horsemanship. 56-year old Lachsen Slimani is also obsessed with riding games. He lives with his family on a remote highland plateau in the Middle Atlas. Lachsen is proud because his 18-year old son Mohammed wants to follow in his fatherâ€™s footsteps. For that he needs his own horse, so the tradition goes. Lachsen wants to fulfil this dream for his son. So, in order to get the money together for the horse, he takes off on an adventure and is travelling to Quarzazate, which is also called the Hollywood of the desert.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: Wild Moments: Four Seasons - Spring & Summer
programme.desc: In accordance with the seasons and with deep respect of nature, people all over the world celebrate their long-standing traditions. In Japan the first picnics at the cherry blossom festival kick off the long-awaited outdoor season, while the Scots perform their Highland Games. In the summer the Latvians celebrate the biggest party of the year: midsummer night. The vast wildflower meadows provide them with wreathes of flowers which have magical healing powers; animals are provided with an abundance of insects. This enables the rare hoopoe to breed in Latvia. In the Spree forest region, an enchanting river landscape south-east of Berlin, farmers still harvest the famous Spreeforest Cucumber. "Four seasons - Many traditions" is a visual journey around the globe meeting people who are passionate and dedicated at keeping old traditions alive.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: In accordance with the seasons and with deep respect of nature, people all over the world celebrate their long-standing traditions. Near the outermost border of Europe, in Bashkiria, generations of bee keepers have collected honey from rare wild bees, the Burzyan bees. In Japan the last of the Usho catch fish with "living fishing rods": trained cormorants. Traditionally, they provided the Emperor's family with fresh fish. In Poland carp are fished from the ponds to provide everybody with carp for Christmas dinner - this is an old Polish tradition. In Frisia winter is driven out by fires at what is known as "Biikebrennen", and in Hungary the "Busho" - frightening characters wearing wooden masks - do a similar job. "Four seasons - Many traditions" is a journey, meeting people who are passionate at keeping old traditions alive.

programme.title: mareTV: The Blue and White Island World of Greece: Mykonos, Naxos and Tinos
programme.desc: Around the once sacred Isle of Delos, some 200 islands, including 20 larger ones, are arranged almost in a circle. This is where the name of the Greek island paradise comes from: Cyclades, a derivation of the Greek word kÃ½klos, circle. Each cyclade has a unique character. The pelican Petros, about 20 years old, is the mascot of Mykonos. He moves from taverna to taverna all day long, scrounging fish. This works out sometimes well and sometimes not so well. Petros does have a few human friends who regularly slip him something, but all too often visitors eager to take pictures block his path. Then he has to "wiggle" his way through the crowd. Jackie Onassis is said to have once brought Petros' "great-grandmother" from Louisiana to the island.

programme.title: Sri Lanka - Tropics, temples and tea plantations
programme.desc: Sri Lanka stands for colourful diversity in all respects. If it's spirituality or Ayurveda you're looking for, here it is. Adventurers and nature lovers can also satisfy their needs here. No one must travel far to discover exotic worlds on this drop-shaped tropical island. "mareTV" delves into the day to day lives of the is-landers, some of whom pursue the most unusual pro-fessions: Uditha Lakmaal is a palm tree climber. He harvests the sap of the trees, known as palm wine, by climbing to the top of them. Sri Lankan stilt fishermen now actually have very little to do with fish and func-tion more as models receiving payment from tourists for acting the part. Anulawathie runs a small floating hoop business, offering car inner tubes for adults and tuk-tuk tubes for children. Different varieties of tea can be found on Herman Gunaratnes tea plantation. Just four carefully selected women are allowed to harvest the exclusive white tea grown there. Each tea leaf is cut individually from the bush by gloved hands and with golden scissors.

programme.title: The Seychelles - Africa with South Seas ambience
programme.desc: The 115 islands and islets that make up the Seychelles present a breath-taking variety of plants, rare animals and beaches laced with palms. This is where the leg-endary Coco de Mer palm nuts grow with fruits weigh-ing up to 20 kilos and giant wild land turtles nibble away at mangrove fruits to their hearts content. The archipelago was first settled at the end of the 18th cen-tury. Today, a very colourful potpourri of peoples in this dwarf state proves just how peacefully different cultures can live side by side. Three times a week, the steamer "MV Espoir" completes the trip from the main island of MahÃ© to Praslin and back. A ship for every-one and practically everything: Used cars, toilet paper, horses, bicycles, furniture - you name it, the Espoir transports goods of all kinds. Coconuts sometimes pose a problem as there are far too many of them. What to do with them? The best place to send them is undoubt-edly Hubert Roumien's Virgin Coconut Oil Laboratory, hidden away in the MahÃ© jungle. Straw turns into gold at Seaweed Seychelles! There, Benjamin Port Louis collects seaweed and extracts liquid fertiliser from it.

programme.title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes
programme.sub-title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes: England: The Pilgrim's Way to Canterbury
programme.desc: In the Middle Ages, the horrifying murder of Archbishop Thomas Becket of Canterbury led thousands of pilgrims to the south of England. Centuries later, the long-forgotten Pilgrims' Way is now enjoying a revival. The Pilgrims Way leads east to west cross-country from Winchester to Canterbury through the counties of Hampshire, Surrey and Kent.

programme.title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes
programme.sub-title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes: France: The Mont-Saint-Michel Way
programme.desc: In honour of the Archangel Michael, thousands of medieval Christians set off on pilgrimages to the famous mountain monastery of the Mont-Saint-Michel in the Atlantic Ocean. Today it continues to enchant millions of visitors each year. But the pilgrimage route from Rouen to the mountain abbey seems to have been forgotten: it leads through the depths of Normandy into rural France.
